TopicTitle: sub assembly's and root part WTF

Articles.Content:
what is the real problem with making subassembly's work with any kind of attachable parts? if it attaches it attaches. seems like a real oversight that makes modular building annoying...

anyone have thougts on this?

dave
If I plan to make a piece a sub-assembly I always start with a modular girder segment, then build from there, tis ensures that I have a free attach node when I go to save my sub assembly.

It's pretty easy to work around. This is how I build my side-mounted space shuttles. After building it in the SPH, I detach everything from the cockpit, delete it, then add a girder, which is then automatically selected as the root part. Then I just attach the fuselage to it, replace the cockpit, grab it at the fuselage, and save the sub. It's really easy, it only needs some logical thinking.

Use the SelectRoot mod.

Seconded. It makes things so much easier to create a module or something, then add a single random part where the module attaches to the launch vehicle, make it the root, and create the sub.

I never had problems with subassemblies as long as I built them as attachments to something. Turning a standalone ship into subassembly may get tricky.
